Subject: Weekly State of the Market - Sovereign Bonds & Rates (2025-09-23)

Sovereign Bonds & Rates

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (CoT) data, limited to Sovereign Bonds & Rates, reveals a pronounced bearish sentiment among speculators regarding future interest rates. Speculators are aggressively net-short across US Treasury futures, particularly in Fed Funds, signaling strong conviction for sustained higher short-term rates or further hawkish action. This environment is characterized by expectations of persistent inflation and a Federal Reserve committed to tight policy.

Key Opportunities

  • Fed Funds Futures (Short): Strong and increasing speculative net-short positioning suggests a momentum play on continued hawkish policy or persistent high short-term rates.
  • Ultra UST Bond Futures (Long): Substantial speculative net-short positioning creates a contrarian opportunity for a short-covering rally if long-term rates unexpectedly decline due to economic deceleration or a policy shift.

Key Risks

  • Interest Rate/Inflation Risk: Extreme speculative bearishness in Fed Funds futures signals market conviction for higher rates, posing a risk of broader market instability if these expectations are aggressively challenged or confirmed with unexpected hawkishness.

Asset Class Summaries

FED FUNDS

  • Speculators: Significantly net-short by -386,831 contracts (376,627 long vs. 763,458 short) as of 2025-09-23, marking a sharp increase in bearishness from the prior week (-119,513 contracts). The 156-week CoT Index is 35.32. (Provided CoT data, rows 0, 5).
  • Commercials: Heavily net-long by +372,704 contracts (709,893 long vs. 337,189 short), indicating a traditional hedger's counter-speculative stance. (Provided CoT data, row 0).
  • Implication: Dominant speculative conviction for higher short-term rates, risking market repricing if the Fed deviates from a hawkish path.

ULTRA UST BOND

  • Speculators: Substantially net-short by -270,759 contracts (145,174 long vs. 415,933 short) as of 2025-09-23. The 156-week CoT Index is 38.24. (Provided CoT data, rows 1, 3).
  • Commercials: Net-long by +114,732 contracts (254,256 long vs. 139,524 short), largely offsetting speculative bearishness. (Provided CoT data, row 1).
  • Implication: Elevated bearish sentiment points to expectations of higher long-term yields, but presents a contrarian opportunity for a rebound.

UST BOND

  • Speculators: Net-short by -78,791 contracts (164,155 long vs. 242,946 short) as of 2025-09-23. The 156-week CoT Index is 46.77. (Provided CoT data, rows 2, 4).
  • Commercials: Slightly net-long by +22,585 contracts (175,651 long vs. 153,066 short). (Provided CoT data, row 2).
  • Implication: A bearish bias, though less extreme than Fed Funds or Ultra UST Bonds, suggests continued pressure for higher yields.
